meanings.definition: Plunges or dips back into a liquid or substance.
meanings.sent1: After washing the dishes, she reimmerses the sponge in the soapy water.
meanings.sent2: The swimmer reimmerses himself in the cool pool after a quick break.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally reimmerses his sleeve in the paint can, creating a colorful mess.
meanings.sent4: The tea bag reimmerses in the hot water, releasing its rich flavor.
meanings.sent5: The rain reimmerses the parched earth, bringing much-needed relief.

meanings.definition: Becomes fully absorbed or engrossed in an activity or experience again.
meanings.sent1: After the break, she reimmerses herself in the challenging puzzle.
meanings.sent2: He reimmerses in his favorite book, losing track of time.
meanings.sent3: The cat reimmerses in chasing the elusive laser pointer.
meanings.sent4: Her mind reimmerses in memories of childhood, vivid and nostalgic.
meanings.sent5: The artist reimmerses in the creative flow, producing masterpiece after masterpiece.
